data.text: The IMF’s increased focus on governance & #corruption over the last two years & our emergency financing are guided by the IMF #anticorruption framework. Rhoda Weeks-Brown takes us through the details at a panel discussion with @CIPE_ACGC  & @WorldBank https://t.co/CCGKUuMGYu https://t.co/e1IfH2GcHd

While moving at great speed to help countries, the IMF has shown that governance & accountability can’t take a back seat during the crisis. Find out how: watch the replay of IMF’s Rhoda Weeks-Brown’s panel discussion with @CIPE_ACGC & @WorldBank https://t.co/CCGKUuMGYu https://t.co/RvV6BxAXxT

Sub-Saharan Africa is racing to close the global digital divide. Internet penetration in the region has grown tenfold since the early 2000s, compared with a threefold increase in the rest of the world. https://t.co/r8mwMfM1TV #DigitalAfrica #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/CLpdypQDDD
IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva appoints Alfred Kammer as Director of the European Department. https://t.co/PSVaOlPQAw https://t.co/X9eN72sVBU
IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva Names Ceda Ogada as Secretary of the Fund and Director of the Secretary’s Department. https://t.co/bSVJFFqQHv https://t.co/VBfYHgH79w

STARTING SHORTLY:
IMF’s Rhoda Weeks-Brown joins in a @CIPE_ACGC panel discussion on how the IMF and @WorldBank help countries improve governance and fight #corruption in the time of #COVID19 and beyond. https://t.co/Qm3PKK2Gec https://t.co/YXyd8ixy6f

In advance of the @CIPE_ACGC panel discussion with IMF’s Rhoda Weeks-Brown & @WorldBank today at 10:30AM (EDT), find out how we sustain the fight against #corruption and aim to prevent the misuse of emergency #COVID19 funding. Watch the livestream ⤵️
https://t.co/Qm3PKK2Gec https://t.co/w12gH4LLOv

➡️Send us your questions for @GitaGopinath, and tune in today at 5:00pm ET for a live conversation about the #globaleconomy in times of #COVID19 with the IMF's Chief Economist and Mercela Eslava of @EconomiaUAndes https://t.co/KSEvPbMS9h

Ensuring strong health systems are in place remains the most urgent #COVID19 priority. Also, #MENA & #CCA countries should gradually turn their attention to facilitating economic recovery by easing the reallocation of workers and rebuilding policy buffers  https://t.co/JyEOMJSlt5

On July 16 at 7am EDT, join us for a virtual live discussion on the key challenges, policy priorities & opportunities for recovery based on the recent #MiddleEast & #NorthAfrica regional economic outlook update. @DIFC @CarnegieMEC https://t.co/Gkp4e0e3CR
REPLAY: 2020 Michel Camdessus Central Banking Lecture. #CamdessusLecture https://t.co/B2dqx2Z2sW

The global food supply chain is prone to falter in the face of shocks, like the #COVID19 pandemic. Read how @WFP @UNEP and others are working to strengthen it. #IMFBlog #GlobalGoals https://t.co/hND9QOqNTI https://t.co/DzTRWHTQKP
Join our discussion with Rhoda Weeks-Brown on how countries can use #COVID19 financial help in transparent and accountable ways. https://t.co/VCWTOGyQ7q

Join us tomorrow for a live conversation on the #globaleconomy in times of #COVID19 with IMF Chief Economist @GitaGopinath and Mercela Eslava, Dean of the Economics Department at @EconomiaUAndes. Wednesday, July 15 at 5:00pm ET. https://t.co/KSEvPbMS9h

Food systems are essential to economic activity, providing the energy we need to live and work. How can we improve them? #IMFBlog #BuildBackBetter #GlobalGoals https://t.co/hND9QOqNTI https://t.co/UKvxWHhg0k
Opening remarks by @KGeorgieva at the 2020 Michel Camdessus Central Banking Lecture. https://t.co/owcc9s54wx #CamdessusLecture https://t.co/ZESTZUmQti

STARTING IN 15 MINUTES: 2020 Michel Camdessus Central Banking Lecture with @SNB_BNS_en’s Thomas J. Jordan, followed by a conversation with @KGeorgieva. https://t.co/7egJ6aZFoW #CamdessusLecture https://t.co/X3foktNbN8
REPLAY: Press Briefing – Regional Economic Outlook Update: Middle East and Central Asia. https://t.co/Zs0e0hDi7Y

“Let’s do the right thing to prevent a #climatecrisis!” Speaking to EU Environment Ministers this morning, @KGeorgieva outlined 3 priorities for a #greenrecovery:
1️⃣Use public money wisely
2️⃣Price carbon right
3️⃣Price climate risks
Read remarks: https://t.co/saAUrQNhKC https://t.co/tEXsa7BsZh

One size does not fit all: new #IMFBlog by @GitaGopinath and Tobias Adrian on how central banks use foreign exchange intervention, capital flow measures and financial regulation to complement interest rates decisions in responding to external shocks. https://t.co/giYYlQW2gw https://t.co/MZeIfT5PP8
How does the #IMF help reshape the global economy in times of crises?  Watch the video.  https://t.co/GrMyV5vdCi https://t.co/5dNVuMbTT4

Jihad Azour: The collapse in remittances resulting from #COVID19 lockdowns has had a significant impact on fragile and conflict-affected states in the #MENA region, as this accounts for 14% of their GDP https://t.co/JyEOMJSlt5

The IMF has provided financial support and policy advice to the #MiddleEast and #CentralAsia region in the wake of #COVID19, providing $17 billion in support to 15 countries thus far https://t.co/JyEOMJSlt5 https://t.co/2bumT1v7q2

Rising deficits raise concerns about debt sustainability in #MENAP and #CCA oil importers, with debt-to-GDP levels expected to hit 95% of GDP on average by the end of the year in #MENAP and 61% in the #CCA https://t.co/JyEOMJSlt5 https://t.co/JWApfAI0bx

IMF growth projections in the wake of #COVID19 have been revised down two percentage points since April for the #MiddleEast and #CentralAsia, with growth now projected at -4.7 percent https://t.co/JyEOMJSlt5 https://t.co/4zuzmcLCfM

Severe oil price fluctuations and production cuts following #COVID19 hit #MENA oil exporters hard, resulting in $270 billion in lost oil revenue relative to 2019. https://t.co/JyEOMJSlt5 https://t.co/7UJ5zuMAYc

“Now is the time to think ahead and reassess how best to use limited fiscal space.” In our latest #IMFblog, IMF’s Director of the European Department Thomsen lays out the path toward a more resilient Europe. https://t.co/eTL7c899ra https://t.co/1X5rADS834

Stay Tuned: on July 13 at 7am EDT (Washington DC Time), join us for a Virtual live Press Briefing on the Regional Economic Outlook Update for #MiddleEast, #NorthAfrica, #Caucasus and #CentralAsia. https://t.co/YXBSn7E20Y
What are the measures taken by #Nigeria to enhance transparency and governance in the use of the $3.4 billion IMF emergency financing? https://t.co/0zqIbYHz5U #IMFAfrica https://t.co/qF7RB1sVPS

It’s easier to work at home in Norway and Singapore than in Turkey or Mexico. More than half of houses in emerging countries don’t even have a computer. Amid #COVID19, IMF researchers ranked how ‘teleworkable’ are jobs in different countries. https://t.co/INQJG5zuZK #IMFBlog https://t.co/zf3UY2w70E

The #COVID19 response is driving global public debt to the highest level in recorded history, but debt levels are expected to stabilize in 2021 due to the rebound in economic activity and low interest rates. Learn more in the latest #IMFBlog  https://t.co/hLMGgpuI8Z https://t.co/nEeL0hfQhd

Medellín, #Colombia went from being the world’s most violent city in 1991 to international recognition as one of the most innovative, inclusive, and sustainable cities in the world. Former mayor @FicoGutierrez on the transformation in the latest F&D: https://t.co/1kO4N78HAB

The poor and the young in the lowest-paid jobs are least able to telework and most vulnerable to layoffs, furloughs or pay cuts. New IMF research shows that workers in hospitality, food, construction and transportation are at the highest risk. https://t.co/INQJG5zuZK #IMFBlog

The #COVID19 pandemic has had a more negative impact than anticipated, and the recovery is projected to be more gradual amidst a lot of uncertainty. Find out more in the latest World Economic Outlook report: https://t.co/WpXSzg9YxA #WEO https://t.co/0820DZvo5m
